case_vignette: A 45-year-old man with a past medical history of hypertension presents with concerns of a rash on his left thigh back that his wife noticed two days ago. The rash has been progressively enlargened. Patient denies any pain or any prior treatments. He thinks the surrounding skin is warm and may be infected, but he denies any drainage.  He reports that they went hiking eight days ago in Rhode Island.   Physical exam demonstrates a non-scaly large targetoid, pink-red patch on the left thigh
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a rash on the back of my left thigh that has been getting bigger, and the skin around it feels warm.
How long have you had the rash, and has it spread to any other areas of your body?
I noticed the rash two days ago and it hasn't spread to any other areas of my body.
Are there any other symptoms like fever, chills, or pain associated with the rash?
No, I haven't experienced any fever, chills, or pain with the rash.
Do you have any known allergies or a recent history of insect bites, new medications, or exposure to new products like soaps or lotions?
I don't have any known allergies, insect bites, or have started new medications. I haven't used any new products like soaps or lotions either. But, I did go hiking about eight days ago.
Has the rash formed any blisters, or is it just red and inflamed?
The rash is just a large, pink-red patch without any blisters.
Is there a history of similar skin issues in your family, such as psoriasis or eczema?
No, there is no history of similar skin issues like psoriasis or eczema in my family.
Final Diagnosis: Cellulitis
